meanings.definition: A child's toy horse on a stick.
meanings.sent1: The little girl happily played with her cockhorse in the park.
meanings.sent2: The children took turns riding the cockhorse during the playtime.
meanings.sent3: The cockhorse seemed to gallop faster when the wind blew through the park.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination soared as she rode the cockhorse through imaginary lands.
meanings.sent5: The colorful cockhorse brought joy to the children's faces as they played together.

meanings.definition: A position of honor or prominence.
meanings.sent1: Being the team captain was a real cockhorse for him.
meanings.sent2: The award ceremony placed him in the cockhorse position among his peers.
meanings.sent3: He felt like a cockhorse when he received the trophy for his hard work.
meanings.sent4: In the spotlight, he stood tall like a proud cockhorse.
meanings.sent5: His promotion to manager was a true cockhorse moment in his career.

meanings.definition: A source of pride or satisfaction.
meanings.sent1: Her artwork was her cockhorse, bringing her joy every time she painted.
meanings.sent2: Completing the marathon was a cockhorse achievement for him.
meanings.sent3: He felt like a cockhorse when he finished the puzzle in record time.
meanings.sent4: The successful project became the cockhorse of the team.
meanings.sent5: The delicious meal she cooked was a cockhorse moment for her culinary skills.
